Now these people look professional and have a "don't mess with us" attitude to begin with until they encounter Alex. Alex is 9 years old and has a wild imagination. He sees the gang breaking into peoples houses looking for the chip and naturally he calls the police. Nothing is found, no one believes him. He takes it on himself to prove that he is telling the truth. I wont say anymore as this movie is fun. Forget the first two when you watch it and you'll enjoy it.

I was home alone one Saturday night and the HBO movie was Home Alone 3.  I was a big fan of the others when I was little, but now being 14, I wasn't so sure about this one.  It started out SO much different from the others and I found myself enjoying it a lot.  The story was great and the kid in it was great too.  I give Home Alone 3 a 10/10.

Four experienced spies and industrial technology thieves, with high qualification in their branch, Beaupre, Alice, Jernigan and Unger, steal a top-secret chip from the Air Force. To make sure they pass the security measures in the Chicago Airport, the skillfully burglars of the most sophisticated security systems hide the microchip in a toy car. The only problem is that the toy, hiding a fortune of hundreds of millions of dollars gets accidentally at the sullen Mrs. Hess which has a weakness for her eight year old neighbor, the naughty Alex Pruitt. Not knowing what to do, the four thieves decide to break into all the houses on Mrs. Hess's street to find the chip, although they are starting to believe that there are big chances that the lost object is in the Pruitt's house. Alex tells his family that he has seen dangerous delinquents on their street, but because he has a rich imagination, nobody believes him. So, he is left home alone while all the family members are gone with business. But Alex isn't vulnerable without his family by his side. Even though he is only eight years old, only when he's left alone he becomes a real danger for the ones who break into his property. The four burglars have what to fear from: Alex has prepared for their visit. A child with a little paint and some household objects (all used to protect his toy from getting stolen) can get even the American Navy into trouble.For the third "Home Alone" movie, Alex D. Linz replaced Macaulay Culkin, which did a quite good job having the lead role. The other actors are Olek Krupa, Rya Kihlstedt, Lenny van Dohlen, David Thornton. The responsible for the script and play is Raja Gosnell, the director of "Home Alone" and "Home Alone 2".I personally enjoyed the movie and I have seen it many times, although it is not as good as the first one, and no one can be better that Macaulay Culkin. What I liked best was that the eight year old boy proved to be a very smart and funny character.written by Alexandra D.

Good watch, probably won't watch again, but can recommend.This kid definitely isn't Macaulay Culkin, but Alex D. Linz was able to carry this movie, and he did it again in "Max Keeble's Big Move".I'll be honest I re-watched this because "Hot Ones" mentioned Scarlett Johansson was in it, and I couldn't remember that. She has a bit role, but even back then (possibly unrefined, the role didn't have a lot to work with) she was a big personality in a small role. She has one, brief, powerful scene that would really be worth remembering: most of it is the messing up the burglars.This has a very different vibe than the first 2 movies. While Kevin was isolated and unable to get help, Alex starts by doing everything right to get help, but no one believes him so he feels forced to "do the right thing". However it manifests in almost a psychotic fashion.Of course, almost everything that happens in this movie should kill someone, but doesn't. It also had a very easy out: at any time Alex could give the chip up, and it would be over, the bad guys leave the country: he's heavily volunteering for this carnage. Kevin was being targeted, he saw their faces and was actually defending himself and his home because the "wet bandits" were coming for HIM.Ultimately it's fun and charming, and interesting what the limits of technology were back in 1997 with cellphones and pagers, RC cars with block long range, but not wireless cameras, but remote control gizmos that can turn on the neighbors tv.The biggest problem I have with it is that his brother's bird is basically as smart a person, having conversations, and taking bribes (or insisting on being paid at least), and the worst bit is that I know there are people with birds as smart as that. I'm not sure if it would be a Conure, but I don't deal in parrots.That said, it's not overly hilarious, it's not bad, but it's just not great either.

reviews.review_title: Better than what the first two put together!
reviews.content: Like many people I know, I think Home Alone 1 & 2 are classic comedies and getting a new cast would make the 3rd installment  not as good as the others. How wrong could I be?!? Home Alone 3 is much better than the first two put together! Culkin had cheekiness to him but Alex D. Linz has cuteness which makes him great with the bad guys. Pesci and Stern were also great but the new bad guys pulled it off. Olek Krupa, Rya Kihlstedt, Lenny Von Dohlen and David Thornton make the excellent team. Though they are intelligent with all their high-tech gadgets, they have no sense between them (so now Alex is able to foil their plans). All are great but Von Dohlen and Thornton are the funniest of all the bad guys and they'd make a great comedy duo. In addition to the new cast is Alex's pet rat Doris and his brother's (Seth Smith) pet parrot to help him. The parrot has some of the most funniest lines of all and confuse the bad guys in the process. This movie is a real kids pleaser but adults will enjoy it too.

*** SPOILER ALERT ***I think the problem with trying to turn out sequels to Home Alone is that that the original concept is not something that you can build on. Here you have a premise of a kid left home alone who has to use physical stunts and painful booby traps to defend the house from adults who want to do him harm. That's not exactly an epic idea. It wasn't a thoroughly ingenious concept for the first one and the sequels only make it worse.Home Alone 3 reeks of desperation. Every element that made the other two films endearing to kids is gone and has been replaced by insufficient copies. Gone are the entire original cast, Macaulay Culkin is now a teenager and wisely turned down an offer to make this movie. Gone are Joe Peschi and Daniel Stern who obviously have better things to do. What remains is a name-only sequel – a remake really – that offers no hints of what turned Home Alone into the best-selling comedy of all time.Culkin has been replaced by a new kid, Alex D. Linz, a cute little mop-top who probably has screen presence but, for me, is nothing more than your standard Hollywood acting kid. Linz plays Alex Pruitt, a different kid who lives in the same kind of suburban Chicago neighborhood with a smaller family (mom, dad, a brother and a sister, who is played by Scarlett Johannson), and an even smaller house. As the movie opens, he gets the chicken pox, which never seems to spread beyond a few small red dots on his neck. He's one of those kids fused with ingenuity and a room loaded with every toy imaginable, including his own telescope and a large pet mouse named Doris.The outside forces that invade Alex's space come from four all-star professional criminals who are tracking a computer chip that they have stolen from a North Korean terrorist group. In an effort to get it past airport security, they hide it inside a remote controlled car and put it inside a shopping bag. At the metal detector, the bag is mistakenly picked up by an elderly woman who takes it home. The crooks track her to her neighborhood but can't locate the toy car. That means they will have to search them all one by one.Alex spots the crooks through his telescope and, unlike Culkin's character, at least has the sense to call the cops right away. The crooks make a break for it before the cops can show up, and that leads to two irritating scenes in which Alex is able to identify the perpetrators AND their car, but the adults are too stupid to do anything but warn him about making phony phone calls . . . twice! As the crooks zero in on Alex, he decides that he has to take care of things himself and that leads to a long, very long, third act in which he sets up a large series of booby traps that include bricks to the head, shots to groin, electrocution, break-away floors, and even a runaway lawnmower. Those scenes are sheer torture, they go on and on and on and on until you just want to wave a white flag. Much to my pain and suffering, as I sat through Home Alone 3, I could imagine that no movie this bad could possibly spawn a Home Alone 4. We'll see.

Can't believe I'm writing a review now after all these years lol, i was 7 years old when it first came out & watching it now brings back many memories i love this movie , its not connected to the precious classics , but honestly its a great enjoyable movie Spically for kids & family also.

reviews.review_title: The criminals have got clever but not as clever as the kid!
reviews.content: Quite often sequels are never as good as the first original film but... there is no difference here. YES Home Alone, i thought was great just like so many other John Hughes films and Home Alone 2 was pretty much the same as the first one with a few obvious differences but really it was not a sequel, it was just another version.Home Alone 3 is actually different and it's good, they couldn't have used the same characters, that would have just been going against the saying 'lightning never strikes twice in the same place', but really this is a good, well thought out story and it flows, not as much as the first Home Alone but it still flows.The acting was good, Alex D. Linz was great, some child actors make me cringe but not Alex, he did a great job! So i would say all the Home Alone films are worth a watch, well the first 3 are, Home Alone 4, is the typical sequel, just made to make money and i doubt it made much,you can tell that one was not written by John Hughes, but still you might enjoy the 4th one, spend a day in watching Home Alone and don't forget the popcorn!

reviews.review_title: Better than what the critics say!
reviews.content: This is a great, fun packed movie, even comparable to the first 2 parts. I loved this, the gadgets, the fun, especially the fact that the kid outsmarts some real high profile crooks, is a real treat. Don't miss

reviews.review_title: Not just underrated, by far the best Home Alone
reviews.content: Every now and then there is a sequel that is just miles ahead of it's predecessors. Rare I know but this is one of them. Vastly superior to the first two and I like all the Home Alone movies although #2 was mildly nauseating. I suspect the low ratings for this movie have more to do with familiarity with the original actors rather than whether or not it's a bad movie. Excellent story, excellent actors, well directed, and very funny. Thoroughly enjoyed it. "Over this Under, over". Ha ha cracks me up every time.

reviews.review_title: Leave It Home. In the Trash.
reviews.content: Home Alone 3 (1997):Dir: Raja Gosnell / Cast: Alex D. Linz, Hoviland Morris, Seth Smith, David Thornton, Olek Krupa: It was bad enough that Home Alone 2 was a Xeroxed copy of Home Alone but Home Alone 3 is a Xerox of a Xerox. A chip has been planted in a toy to make it past airport security but the wrong person picks it up and it ends up in Chicago. The villains seeking the chip are spotted by young Alex D. Linz but police do not buy his story. The parents exists for the purpose of going to work while Linz booby traps the house in wait for the villains. Linz owns a mouse and a parrot that act upon his every command and this is stupid in itself in its dreadful presentation. The mouse crawls up someone's leg while someone else takes a swing at it with a crowbar. No points in guessing where the impact connects. Director Raja Gosnell provides the same story with absolutely no originality. He just adds a couple more crooks. Linz recites Macaulay Culkin and nobody cares. In lame appearances are Hoviland Morris, Seth Smith, and David Thornton who will likely not gain any recognition from this sh*t stain holiday crap. The crooks are four without the name actors wasting their talent looking stupid on camera. If you have seen Home Alone then you have seen Home Alone 3 and if you have seen Home Alone 3 then you have my deepest sympathy. Score: 1 / 10

reviews.review_title: Home Alone 3 is Set in January
reviews.content: The biggest detriment to this film is the absence of it's predecessors' cast and crew. The decision to call it Home Alone 3 is also slightly baffling, in that it bears zero connection to the previous duology. Although, from a sales point of view, what else were they gonna call it? Dealing with such a nostalgic pair of movies in Home Alone's 1 & 2, everyone in or around those productions has become iconic, and near and dear for the hearts of devout fans. On it's own steam, could this movie justify itself or leave any such legacy?Well, John Hughes wrote this movie. Can you believe that? Can't get any closer to home, Jeez that works well here, without the guy who started it all... But the script is not top-form here by any means. There's a couple of lines here and there where you still stop and go, man, he was a good writer. Early on, one of the baddies (of which there are now 4) Earl Unger (David Thornton) remarks wryly to his colleagues; "When I was in the John, I didn't see anything", in regards to a misplaced microchip capable of removing missiles from Air Defence radar. This whole Government espionage plot is all well and good, and props to John Hughes for figuring out a new angle after seemingly going all-out in Part II. The four antagonists, including a female this time round, are all great actors, but unfortunately aren't given enough to do, individually. Lenny von Dohlen in particular is such a talent, gone to waste here. Olek Krupa delivers charisma and terrific sinister intent as the group's leader, Peter Beaupre, and gets the most time to shine out of all of them. Our hero in Home Alone 3, Alex Pruitt, played by Alex D. Linz, is a perfectly admirable successor for Macauley Culkin. Both of these kids did such a good job, carrying the film for adult viewers while also giving the younger audiences a likeable character to root for. If it wasn't for Linz, the film wouldn't work as good, since he really proves to be a great little actor. There's no development for young Pruitt however. He doesn't learn much by the end of the film's runtime like Kevin McAllister did. His family, (Haviland Morris) the mother, (Kevin Kilner) the father, (Scarlett Johansson) the sister and (Seth Smith) the brother, all do a good job, but are certainly a downgrade from that huge assortment of McAllister's, who were each quirky and idiosyncratic in their own way. There's no Uncle Frank (Gerry Bamman) anymore, or Buzz (Devin Ratray).The first two movies I can picture anyone enjoying. Home Alone 3 is essentially a kids movie. The humour a lot of the time is directed towards a younger audience, and it's not just the slapstick. As a little tyke, I almost wet my pants watching Mr. Unger fall down a flight of stairs with the mega blocks trolleys attached to his feet. The traps sequence goes on for far too long here, leaning towards tedium. The final thirty-five minutes of the film are devoted to them. Worse yet, they aren't executed with the same level of skill of the previous two films. Former director Chris Columbus had an eye for the subtle choreography needed to make every boobytrap land. There are a few exceptions though. Mr. Jernigan (Dohlen) getting his ass electrocuted on the chair, Mr. Beaupre (Krupa) smashing his arm on the front door going "wow, ow, ow" and of course, Ms. Alice Ribbons (Rya Kihlstedt) "smacking Mr. Jernigan's winky" with a hockey stick, are all on the level of the first two films. That scene in particular, hitting the partner in crime because of a frightful creature, (a pet spider in the original and now a pet rat named Doris), somehow brings the series full circle. In an odd way, I'm kind of delighted that I can get to call this a trilogy, just cos of the novelty.I feel that people are far too critical of this sequel, due exclusively to their affectionate disposition to the preceding entries. For the first third of it's runtime, Home Alone 3 is actually rather enjoyable. When the same plot point occurs twice, (Alex calling the cops after witnessing one of the intruders), the overall pacing of the film slows down. The set-piece with the toy race car goes on for a little too long as well. It's a shame because prior to that, the movie is surprisingly engaging.Composer John Williams is replaced by Nick Glennie-Smith here, so already you're losing a bit of that magic from the first two. Nevertheless, there's a few good pieces, and the tunes "Home Again" by Oingo Boingo and "My Town" by Cartoon Boyfriend, are each memorable. This movie isn't set during Christmastime at all. Somehow rather unprecedentedly, it pulls off atmosphere. The late 90's, cold snowy U.S suburbia in January is immortalised on film.For all of these prior quibbles, I'm still happy that this movie even exists. Plans for Home Alone 3 date back to 'Lost In New York', when John Hughes had pitched doing them back-to-back, with the same cast and crew. Despite my undying enthusiasm towards such a prospect, I ask myself how many times could the McAllister's forget Kevin, or how many times could Harry (Joe Pesci) and Marv (Daniel Stern) fall for his same old tricks. Still, Chris Columbus and crew really made something special with the original two, and I reckon they could've pulled it off at least one more time...Home Alone 3 is still inherently a Home Alone movie. The premise is there. The slapstick, albeit forced at times, is there. I feel it can sit alongside the first two, but not too close. Kids will love it. I should know, I used to look up to this fictional Alex Pruitt kid...

reviews.review_title: Not horrible, but inferior with the first two.
reviews.content: My Take: Not as bad as reported, but its definitely worse than the first two. It's hard to separate John Hughes with the HOME ALONE formula, and there's a question of why. I mean HOME ALONE, while a decent and likable film with a high box-office count, wasn't THAT great. It's not worth seeing over and over again as "different" films. Hughes doing a sequel, HOME ALONE 2: LOST IN NEW YORK, was understandable, but why could he stop when even he knows the red-light is on. As producer, perhaps the blames on Hughes why there's a knife-wielding thug in the big-screen version of DENNIS THE MENACE. After that, he did BABY'S DAY OUT, which takes out the eight-year old kid and the two bumbling burglars and replaces them with a baby and the Three Stooges (actually, inspired by them). Doesn't he know when it's time to wrap it up? Actually no, as he produces (and writes) HOME ALONE 3, a second sequel to the already overused HOME ALONE formula. Actually, however, HOME ALONE 3 is slightly better than other HOME ALONE imitators, even if this one isn't far from being one itself. But for the record, I enjoyed HOME ALONE 3 more than see three full grown men and baby or a smarmy old thug matching wits with Dennis the Menace. Instead of bringing back Macaulay Culkin to play the kid, they probably felt that he (and the audience) have gone far too old for the role, so they instead settle for a much younger and juvenile Alex D. Linz, who actually makes a charming replacement which doesn't try to duplicate his predecessor. And instead of bringing back the two thugs, they settle for four more, and these time, their not Wet Bandits (or Sticky Bandits, whatever!). They're a couple of thieves searching for a microchip which they put inside a remote control car. Accidentally, they get their bags mixed up with an old lady (Marian Seldes), who then gives it to little Alex. So it's bad day for the thugs again, ain't it always? In comparison to its predecessors, HOME ALONE 3 is just another pale imitation. Rating: **1/2 out of 5.

reviews.review_title: The worst sequel I have ever seen
reviews.content: Remembering the dirty particulars of this insidiously vapid "movie" is akin to digging into your chest cavity with a rusty, salted spoon. Perhaps "Home Alone 2: Lost in New York" (1992) was a bit on the predictable side, but this pathetic excuse for a film is just one of the most shameless bids at commercialization I have ever heard of. A boy fighting off spies/terrorists when he's home alone in a Chicago suburb with the chickenpox? Ridiculous! Why did this film have to be made? I am the kind of person who believes even terrible movies are not wastes of time, but rather learning experiences. However, this is actually a waste of time. It should be avoided at all costs.

reviews.review_title: tolerable at best. pretty cool traps.
reviews.content: I have to admit when this first came out I was not thrilled about a new kid but hey Macaulay culkin can't stay a kid forever so I gave this one a chance and waited for it to come on VHS and then my mom bought it on VHS at sam's club. The movie is about a kid named Alex pruitt played by Alex d. linz and he lives in a suburban chicago neighborhood. He has 2 older siblings who pick on him and busy parents who work all the time. One night he gets the chicken pox and has to stay home from school for a couple of days and his parents could not find anyone to babysit him so they just let him stay home alone. Meanwhile 4 james bond type villains lose a very powerful computer chip and they think someone who lives in alex's neighborhood has it in there house. Anywhoo Alex spots one of the criminals in one of his neighbors house and he calls the cops and they don't believe him so he has to take matters into his own hands and sets up booby traps for the four criminals. Not as funny or classic as the first 2 but It's tolerable but not really needed in the series but kids will enjoy it. The criminals appear to be smarter and sneakier but Harry and Marv will always be the best burglars in the series. I gotta tell you this movie is a classic compared to the despicable home alone 4.

reviews.review_title: No I don't think it's as good as 1 & 2, but it ain't bad eighther
reviews.content: It was inevitable that John Hughes would come up with another Home Alone even though MaCauly Culkin was too old to return for the role he did so well in the first 2 pictures. Like Halloween 3, I think people hate this because it has nothing to do with the charecters or events of the first film. Just because it goes a different direction, doesn't make it bad movie. There are exceptions however.!!!POSSIBLE SPOILERS!!!Alex cathces the chicken pox and has to stay home while his siblings go off to school, father goes on a buisness trip, and mother goes to work. 4 burglars who are looking for a computer chip break into the house where this boy lives, not knowing of the traps he has set for them.Good story, acting, and some funny moments. ***1/2 out of *****.

I was a huge fan of the home alone franchise, until this movie came out, no disrespect to the actors but nobody can replace Macauley Culkin.Story was dull, the jokes felt way too forced, a true representation of a reboot trying to live up to a classic comedy Christmas movie, didn't really like the 4th either.Avoid if you can.

It seems everyone doesn't like this movie??? I actually like it. I think people take another sequel with none of the originals badly but this film has breathed a breath of fresh air into a series that was becoming stagnate. Ill make it clear, i liked the first two films, every Christmas they are a must. HA3 was a new situation (not forgetting the basic format) new people and new ideas - lets take it to international terrorisum (dont worry, violent is something this film isn't!!) The plot is simple, this time its a kid at home sick from school and havoc reigns while his family are out for the day. This is a must to watch. Two things i advise are: 1, When you watch this, forget about the first two films. 2, Don't think Home Alone 4 is a continuation of this.

I'm not sure why this movie got such bad reviews. I love it! The character of Kevin couldn't last forever. The acting abilities of the kid in this movie was great. Also, the criminals in this one were much more advanced than the first two movies. It's not my favorite of the Home Alone series, but it's definitely not a terrible movie!

reviews.review_title: Alex is home with the chicken pox and has to go against crooks who are after the toy car he got for shoveling snow.
reviews.content: This is one of my favorite Home Alone movies. The fact that a kid can beat grown adults is quite funny. What amazes me though is that in the beginning they were so smart, and had out run the FBI that long without being caught. To be outsmarted by a kid who was eight, and home with chicken pox. That and he had no help because they all thought he was lying from the calls to the police, that were believed to be false alarms, but were in fact accurate. But they avoided being caught when they got their. But they gradually get stupid, and slip up and easily fall into the traps that Alex has laid out for them. Even mistaking the gun he brought with a dart gun, how did he even pick it up. No matter, it was still one of the best movies I have Ever seen

Despite the leading role not being fulfilled with Mackuely Culkin, this boy did a Marvelous job at playing Kevin. It has laughter throughout the movie, love, dark moments and everything wrapped up in it to make a really great 3rd film. Great casting and storyline as well. A+++ Film!

reviews.review_title: Sigh... I was one of those that said "This Sucks!"
reviews.content: PrefaceFirst of all, I didn't plan to write this much. Heck, this film deserves it.ReviewI openly admit that many, many years ago I watched this movie and only made it to the first 10 minutes. I picked up the remote and went "click". I never thought about the movie again... Until Netflix streaming. I could not get over the biggest hurdle - the bar that Culkin, Pesci, and Stern firmly established. Home Alone 3 is an excellent case of overcoming the "Real McCoy" status most people assigned to Home Alone 1 and 2. Any sequel that succeeded these didn't stand a chance unless it was released 20+ years later. That is the principal failure with Home Alone 3. This winter Home Alone 3 was available on Netflix streaming. I thought, "It's a lazy day. I'm stuck inside. Let's see if I get past 10 minutes." I ended up ROFLOL. I watched it 3 more times that week! Then, I started wondering why I didn't give it a chance many years ago. That's when I figured it out. Culkin, Pesci, and Stern are the Home Alone "Dream Team" combo. Any Home Alone production that immediately followed them was destined to have a tough time even if the master writer John Hughes penned it.It's like your favorite player or coach going to a new team. It does not mean your team is worthless. It means things change. New stars emerge. From a technical POV, I was struck by how much spatial integrity was used in this film. You saw crucial characters (the kid and criminals) in the same shots together. There were no cop-out techniques used like the customary cuts and close-ups that "trick" the viewers into believing scenes were shot together when they weren't. Spatial Integrity takes time to setup and achieve precision timing. Home Alone 3 actually surpasses Home Alone 1 & 2 in several ways.1. Alex, the kid, has an infectious laugh. 2. Alex is sheer fun to watch. I love Alex's attitude with the police come to his house to dress him down about false alarms, and when he gives the criminals an "Ouch" moment. This kid emotes very well!3. Alex is smarter. John Hughes established at the top of the film this kid is different. He enters and wins science competitions unlike Kevin. We are told Kevin is "le incompetent." We don't know how he magically gets skills to take out criminals. And we don't care because we're LOL. After watching Home Alone 3, I started to wonder, "How did Kevin know how to do all that stuff?!" 4. These criminals are serious, skilled, and full of themselves. That's why it's even funnier that they "get taken down by a toddler". 5. Including a mouse and a talking and snoring parrot is brilliant.6. The supporting cast is better.7. And the story is superior. Thus, if you were like me many years ago that passed on this film, give it another chance. Don't compare it to the Dream Team productions. It's the ignored little brother or sister that has talent, which no one took the time to notice.

In the beginning I was bit disappointed and annoyed and desperate because everything looked predictable, amateur, and same or worse than previous two sequels and actors. Also unrealistic that kid can make all that so fast. But later it got interesting, surprising, challenging, and positive. Bit funny.

reviews.review_title: Terrorists In A Quiet Suburban Neighborhood
reviews.content: It's almost the Holiday Season, so a lot of us are going to want to watch Home Alone and Home Alone 2. It seems that after those films, movies with slapstick humor where a kid takes down adults haven't worked that well. Another film I reviewed which I prefer and it has a lot of similarities to the two Home Alone films is Blank Check which didn't do as well. They have since done 5 Home Alone movies, and while I agree that they didn't need 4 and 5, it seems like everybody's complaint is having a different kid in the Home Alone movies besides Macaulay Culkin, and different burglars besides Harry and Marv not wanting to give the other Home Alone movies a chance. I guess they didn't need to put the title Home Alone in them. Out of all the Home Alone movies that have been made, this one is like my favorite for a few reasons. I remember watching this film over and over as a kid. Let's think, you can watch the trailer and beginning of the movie, and it won't seem like a Home Alone movie, which is a common movie complaint. But, by all means the trailer and opening scenes are really cool. That being said, I like the criminals in this movie better than in any of the Home Alone movies, as the burglars are mostly cheesy in the other movies except Harry. This time, rather than burglars trying to rob houses they are terrorists looking for a computer chip in a neighborhood, for some kind of terror plot that is hard to understand. These 4 criminals are quite smart, and this time they use technology which is even incredible years later, as the prior Home Alone movies didn't show much technology, like no computer in their house or anything. The way these criminals work together as a team is astounding. Other things that make this movie better, one is I like Alex better than Kevin. Alex is a cute kid, and remembering the prior Home Alone films, we can remember how Kevin has a bad attitude, the way he talked to his mom and family in the beginning of the movie, would get a lot of us in trouble. Kevin seemed selfish wanting to spend a lot of time alone. Alex is a more likable kid, and seems like a more typical kid than Kevin, he is no where near as bratty or selfish. He also seems smarter, as Kevin didn't seem like a smart kid, only enough to set up traps. Alex seems like quite an intelligent kid and respectful. He is the only one in his neighborhood aware that houses are getting broken into, as the terrorists didn't leave behind any evidence of burglary. Alex is also more of a role model than Kevin, especially in a scene where Alex talks about taking action and becoming defensive. It sounds better than when Kevin said, "This Is My House, I Have To Defend It." I also like Alex's neighborhood more than Kevin's, as I feel like his neighborhood is more of a typical middle class neighborhood, and in Alex's neighborhood all the houses look the same keeping the criminals from knowing which house the computer chip is in, while in Kevin's neighborhood, we only know of a couple of houses and it seems like the burglars are mostly after Kevin's house. I feel like Alex's family, is more of a typical family than Kevin's family. Rather than see a big family getting ready for vacation, this movie does not take place during Christmas, but early in January where we see his family and neighborhood in routine activities like work and school seeming like a realistic community. Mrs. Hess also seemed more like a typical neighbor than Old Man Marley or the Pigeon Lady. I also like the music in the movie, including the song "My Town." Earlier today, I listened to that song on YouTube and after hearing that empowering song and seeing a couple of comments from people who like this one better, I decided to write a review for this movie when I wrote one way back in 2003. I deleted that previous review. The movie does get a little cheesy when the action takes place changing the terrorists characters, by all means it is still a great movie. Some of us will love it and some will hate it, but seriously if it bothers you that it's a Home Alone movie you should overlook that. I give this movie a 9/10, it getting cheesy gives it a lower review but I really like this movie for my title of terrorists being in a neighborhood that seemed like any neighborhood. It's interesting to think of international terrorists in a typical neighborhood with an 8 year old boy.

reviews.review_title: Gave me the urge to vomit
reviews.content: This was a horrible sequel and a big waste of time. The first two films were excellent, even though they had similar plots. This pathetic third installment has a similar plot and ruins it. It was obvious if they ever made another Home Alone, Culkin would be to old, but what on Earth kept them from using Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern? The bad guys in this film are horrible. They are complete idiots, but it is very obvious they are not supposed to be that way. What made Pesci and Stern so amusing was how they were obviously not going to try to be serious. The kid in this film is horrible nd far more annoying than Culkin could ever be. The gadgets are simplistic and boring. I know this is a kids movie, but on behalf of kids everywhere, IT STINKS!

reviews.review_title: Wow! This HOME ALONE is really good!
reviews.content: Wow! This HOME ALONE is really good! I absolutely love the traps that Alex (Alex D. Linz) set for the burglars. I couldn't even begin to tell you what trap I liked best. If you ask me, it's a pity no one would believe him the first time he said he saw the bad guys. When Mrs. Hess was tied up in the garage, I got a little uneasy. If you want to know why, you'll have to see the movie. In my opinion, the way the burglars looked at the end was absolutely hilarious! You'll have to see the movie if you want to know why I said that, too. In conclusion, I highly recommend this HOME ALONE that's really good to anyone who liked the first two. You're in a good time, so go to the video store, rent it or buy it, kick back with a friend, and watch it. I guarantee you you're going to have a good time watching it.

Three times definitely isn't the charm with this 3rd and hopefully final installment about a clever boy left home alone to take on the bad guys one more time.Linz lacks the snap and crackle of Culkin, who was smart enough to say no to this film. John Hughes may need to take a little rest.

Directed by Raja Gosnell (Scooby Doo, Beverly Hills Chihuahua, Never Been Kissed as well as the editor of the first two movies in this series) and written and produced by John Hughes, this was the first Home Alone movie not to feature actor Macaulay Culkin as Kevin McCallister or director Chris Columbus and composer John Williams. It was also the last movie in the series to actually play big screens.Terrorists Peter Beaupre (Olek Krupa), Alice Ribbons (Rya Kihlstedt), Burton Jernigan (Lenny Van Dohlen) and Earl Unger (David Thornton, the husband of Cyndi Lauper) have taken a million dollar microchip and hidden it in a remote control car that has been given as a gift by old Mrs. Hess (Marian Seldes) to new protagonist Alex Pruit (Alex D. Linz) when he shovels her driveway. You can guess what happens next, right?Home Alone 3 going to be made at the same time as Home Alone 2: Lost in New York but that idea didn't happen. There was also the idea to have Culkin to return as a teenage Kevin but that didn't occur either.An 11-year-old Scarlett Johansson is Alex's sister Molly which is, I guess, one thing to look out for while this movie just drags. Oh yeah - James Saito, Shredder himself, plays a crime boss.This movie is not good but compared to where the Home Alone movies would go after this...

I love this film and I thought it was the best winter-themed film ever made when I just finished it. Though I really pity that most people despise this film. I can possibly see why. Because it claims to be a Home Alone film, and Kevin McCallister isn't even cameo-ed in this film. I understand that, but that shouldn't affect the rating that much. If it had a different title, I predict the ratings would go to more of a 6.5 stars average.So about the film, I love it! I recommend it head-on. The music pumps you up, the visuals are a little too white, but you can get used to that, the plot is odd, but its really fun to see it go, the bad guys are very dopey and funny to laugh at, they're supposed to be terrorists instead of just a couple of bandits like from the original Home Alones, the scenes with the parrot are entertaining because the parrot always has quotes to say, and the traps in this film are very violent like in Home Alone 2, but they're very funny traps yet they are extremely precise.Get off your chair and watch it!

reviews.review_title: Creative, suspenseful, good acting, and fun.
reviews.content: I thought this movie was very creative, with wonderful animation by the parrot and the rat. I liked it better than Home Alone 1 & 2. I laughed constantly and I found it believable. This was one of the best movies I ever saw in my entire life.

reviews.review_title: Ten pounds of crap in a five pound bag
reviews.content: I would like to say that curiosity got the best of me. If only I saw a trailer, I'd be able to tell you the whole plot of the movie; I could have saved myself the most pointless one hour and forty minutes in my entire life, and about twenty dollars. This movie was a disaster waiting to happen, and it is an embarrassment to Hollywood.The movie displays a vivid ignorance of reality. For example, this kid's remote control race car goes all over the neighborhood, and even enters this house. It's even covered with clothes. Is it not rational to believe that a remote can no longer transmit a signal under those circumstances? Hollywood obviously did not believe so. Common logic and any concept of electronics dictates the opposite; I doubt the race car could even have reached the street, let alone a house across the street. Another unrealistic trait is the lack of intelligence the criminals possess. Why is it in all these movies, these criminals are rocket scientists until they encounter an eight-year old? The kid is meant to be the most intelligent person in the movie instead of professional terrorists? Please, there's more reality in The Matrix. Also, the leader puts down his real pistol and "accidentally" picks up a plastic pistol; apparently, he could not tell the difference. Even with a glove on, one should be able to do that. Just because they look the same does not mean anything; there is other senses then sight. The traps are unrealistic as well; if any one of them actually worked, the criminals would be dead. But, Hollywood intends for us to "laugh" at the "funny" results of the traps. I did not laugh; I sighed and rolled my eyes.But, I recommend this movie to anyone who thinks they have seen a really bad movie; the movie they saw will seem like Citizen Kane compared to this one. Otherwise, skip this one for the sake of your pride. Home Alone 3 also raises a question. We all know Alex D. Linz stars in the movie, but did he write it as well?

This is not home alone .I repeat , this is not home alone !
Not even close to the original
The movie is unfunny , unrealistic ( compared to the original) and trash .The actors were so bad, the plot was terrible, the screenplay was even worse . The character is too young , coincidences are too high, and random stuff happens ...
I don't recommend anyone to watch the movie

I'm generally very lenient when it comes to movies, but this is one of the worst I've ever watched. As expected, it's a bland copy of the first movie that attempts to reuse the same jokes. They're a lot less funny the second time, especially when each one has been ruined by cheesy cartoon sound effects and garbage acting. This film introduces a spy element as the twist on the story, however the plot is cliche and the whole thing is extremely unrealistic. On top of all that, the kid is not even a likable character. Don't waste your time. Watching paint dry is more entertaining than this egregious film.

Home Alone 3: 3.7/10? In this 3rd film, Alex Pruitt,(played by Alex D. Linz) is Home Alone with the chicken pox. The burglars are looking for a computer chip hidden in a toy car that Alex got from shoveling snow. I would have to admit, this wasn't as good as Home Alone or Home Alone 2: Lost in New York, but it still deserved more 3.7 out of 10!A good family film. More like 6.3/10 starsPG contains the slapstick action, a swear or two, and an image of partial nudity.-Kevin Kilbride-

Home Alone 3 is an absolute let down in every way imaginable. Even at its best, it feels like a cheap copy of the two previous films. It's unfunny, mostly boring, and has zero charm. Meaning it basically lacks everything that made Home Alone and Home Alone 2 good.One of the biggest problems, by far, is that this film is boring. For the first two-thirds of the film, nothing happens. It tries to create tension with a needlessly over the top spy plot that lacks any intrigue. The plot, which quite frankly is stupid, never once made me care about it. I had a hard time buying the idea behind it, and for that most part, it made zero sense. There are no heartwarming moments, nor are there any funny moments. It's a film filled with scene after scene of nothing. What's even worse is that this is supposed to be a Christmas film. However, apart from the snowy ground, there is no mention to anything even remotely related to Christmas. A holiday film's main goal is to give a Christmasy feel, Home Alone 3 didn't even try.The story, which thankfully doesn't follow the formula of the two earlier films in the series, is quite awful. Alex, the main protagonist, accidentally receives an incredibly dangerous computer chip, while internationally wanted spies are trying to hunt it down. The spies, who are of course quite dumb, end up facing Alex and all the traps that he has prepared for them and a battle, similar to the ones at the end of the previous films, commences. While that might sound interesting and entertaining on paper, the actual result is the exact opposite. And therein, lies Home Alone 3's biggest problem. It's never entertaining or funny. The end battle, which is the highlight of the two predecessors, is an unfunny and unimaginative copy. The traps rely on the home invaders to make stupid decisions to work, and the reactions that they give to being hit by them can't be compared to the ones given by Harry and Marv.The only redeeming factor I can come up with is that this film ditches the original characters. Had the main character been named Kevin, and the bad guys, Harry and Marv, this would've been even worse. At least now, it feels like it isn't part of the series despite its name. Which begs the question, why is this film even named 'Home Alone'? It has nothing to do with the first two films, and it follows a completely different framework. If I hadn't known that this film was called Home Alone 3, I would've never guessed that it's part of the series. I'm sure that the name brought a lot of money on its own, and that's probably what the people behind it were banking on. But, if you do call the film 'Home Alone', at least make the kid be home alone. The fact that he spends a couple of hours every day on his own doesn't really make it home alone. How hard could it be to come up with anything that would've forced him to be on his own? The atmosphere of this film never works because Alex's parents and siblings are in the house almost all the time.While this film is anything but great, I probably would've enjoyed it more had it not been part of the Home Alone series. However, because it is, I spent most of the time comparing it to two films that are superior in every way. This could've been an okay kids spy film had it been its own thing. Instead, it put all its eggs in one basket and hoped that the name and the battle sequence at the end would be enough to satisfy anyone watching. Unfortunately for Home Alone 3, those things didn't come even close to being enough.

reviews.review_title: If anyone thought Home Alone 2 was a bad sequel, this was a huge step down from that.
reviews.content:
Home Alone 3 (1997) is a movie my daughter and I recently watched together on Disney+. The storyline follows a stolen top secret microchip that is accidentally lost at an airport and brought to a Chicago home by an unsuspecting carrier. The carrier gifts the chip to a child thinking it is a remote control car. The people who stole the microchip track it to the Chicago neighborhood and find the kid more challenging than expected in their attempts to steal the microchip back.This movie is directed by Raja Gosnell (Never Been Kissed) and stars
Alex D. Linz (red Dragon), Scarlett Johansson (Black Widow), Marian Seldes (The Haunting), Richard Hamilton (Pale Rider), Kevin Kilner (Raising Helen) and Olek Krupa (Hidden Figures).The storyline for this was kind of blah and not that great. The characters are okay but not as good as the previous two films. It was fun seeing a young Scarlett Johansson in this, but overall the cast isn't memorable.The parrot wasn't as funny as they hoped but the butt inspection gloves reference and the boobytraps and hijinks at the end were fun, though a bit too over the top. If anyone thought Home Alone 2 was a bad sequel, this was a huge step down from that.Overall this was a movie made to capitalize off the greatness of the first film. There's nothing memorable or worth seeing here. I would score this a 2.5/10 and recommend skipping it.

reviews.review_title: I liked this one better than the first two...yes I'm serious...
reviews.content: Home Alone 3 is a feel good comedy that delivers great acting,a slightly different plot,and some funny parts.The plot is almost the same basic thing,but it had some different approaches in it.Instead of the parents leaving their kid home alone accidentaly,the kid stays home from the chicken pox.New comer Alex D. Linz gives a surprisingly good performance,and the new thungs give good performances,but not as good as Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern.There is now four criminals in this movie,which means more traps,and now the criminals have a new motive.Some of the comedy in this movie is funny,but most of it is childrens humor.For one thing,I'm f****** surprised that ROGER EBERT liked this.I would strongly recommend Home Alone 3 to children and I would also recommend it for adults.Call me crazy but I liked this movie better than the first two,I dont know why,but this one has a more different approach.Home Alone was great,Home Alone 2 was o.k,but Home Alone 3 was the best.10 out of 10.

I dont know how many times I have watched this movie since its release but still it makes me laugh. As some other reviewers has said, they should not have named this Home Alone 3. This movie actually has a better story line but the fighting/tricks and traps, are more unrealistic and cartoonish than the previous movies which makes it more fun. The best part is the great acting of the bad guys. Keeping a serious face while clumsy things keep happening. The bad guys in the previous movies were pretty funny too but surely this movie deserves more than 4.4.

I think it's the best comedy I've seen recently. This movie was more quick development than I thought.Home Alone3, hero played by Alex.D.Linz. It is enjoy popularity movie series. During his mother absence, he faced up to thieves that he used to a lot of funny devices. His devices over 20, but thieves are not learns a lesson to come his house. This is intelligence battle between Alex and thief. Which is the winner?? It severe battle is continuedThis comedy is a mind-boggling and funny movie. I thought actors had great chemistry. So viewers are excited by the severe screen acting. Then, the sounds track is important to this movie. Especially, surprise scene is essential to good sounds. You have get to see. I want to see it again.

It's actually not as bad as everyone thinks. I actually thought it was better than the first two. To be honest, I was actually bored of the first two because I've seen it too many times. To me, Home alone 3 never gets old. (Home Alone 4 was the flop PEOPLE!!!!!) The main reason why I liked it was Alex D. Linz. He's a good actor. The other reasons were because I thought the traps were funnier. (The only 'trap' that I liked in Home Alone 1 was when there was somebody at the door and Kevin used a tape to scare him off. He fast forward over someone talking and used the other parts to talk to the guy.) This time there were 4 bad guys. That meant more comedy. To me, thats a HUGE bonus.Others may not like this movie, but to me, it's a 3 and a half star movie.

reviews.review_title: Definitely the worst Home Alone movie
reviews.content: I recently tried to watch this movie on Disney+ because I never watched it before, but I turned it off after about 30 minutes because it was so bad. I love the first 2 Home Alone movies, but this is definitely the worst one I've seen. I haven't watched Home Alone 4 or 5, and I don't plan to watch them anytime soon.

reviews.review_title: Give it a chance it's good!
reviews.content: This movie is good I can't understand all the hate.. No it's not the same the first 2 parts but still it's a good movie and the boy Alex is so cute smart and caring.. It's fun!!

reviews.review_title: Well not a 1, obviously, but seeing it as the insult it is, i'm giving a 1
reviews.content: Here's a movie without any purpose, a cash grab visible from a mile away, no original actor who could be left somewhere alone a third time, sure, let's find someone else, but still call it '3' as if it had anything to do with the first two films. On its own, with a decent director, it could have been developed into something decent. But as it is, the badnicks are way way over the top cartoony, and the stupid flashy ways they are dealt with, ugh. As a kid i was unfortunate enough to get pulled in a cinema for this, lucky me, i wasn't told this was officially in the same series as the others, and i didn't suffer actually. I was like, 7-8 at the time. From 9 and upward, not recommended.
It doesn't terrible , but after 1 and 2 it was disappointing when I watched it as a kid.

reviews.review_title: See the movie for what it is, not how original it's not!
reviews.content: Most people does the mistake of comparing movies against each other. Sure, I've watched them from the first, on to the next and found the first two quite good. I didn't however expect this one to be any good since that kid who played little Kevin (Macaulay Culkin) wasn't in it.I was quite mistaken. Had this movie been made in parallel it'd been just as good as the original. That said and fully aware of the 'gags' used are not new, but in a sadistical humorous way they were pretty damn funny. Like that mechanical grass-trimmer (Not sure what they're called really, not motorized anyhow) who gave that dude a nice trim. Also that sling-shot was nice too.I'd guess that everyone would love to have this bright a kid. It's nice to see such kids, just because they are so vivid and awake. Difficult to explain, but yeah. They're fun to talk to. OK, so this was in the script since it's a movie, but not every other kid can perform a role such as this.Another thing also. Most people here who'we voted on this movie is probably +20 years old and, as I said, compared this with the other two movies and just because of a no-show by Macaulay Culkin, they dismissed it.See it for what it is!

Wow! it was such a good movie! It was hilarious! Alex D. Linz was sooo cute and small and such a good actor. Better than Machuly who? Maybe the "Adults" didn't like it because they are boring to me and I'm 13 (so is Alex! Teeheehee!) Overall, it was just a great movie! Anything with Alex D. Linz is a good movie!

Undoubtedly the best of all the "Home Alone" movies, of which four now exist and who knows if a fifth will ever be planned. This kid is a believable kid rather than the smart-alecky type seen in HA 1 or 2 and he's not left alone because of missing a flight for a family vacation. He experiences what many kids can identify with: not always seen or heard by their elders and sometimes misunderstood by them, though much loved by their parents. It's a lot of fun seeing how this little boy outwits slick and (supposedly) well-trained international black market spies. He's also sensitive to his elderly neighbor and far more genuous than his counterpart in the first two films. His pets (a white rat named Doris and a garrulous parrot) add color to the whole operation of thwarting cut-throat thieves. Sit back and enjoy the ride! Laughs for parents and children alike.

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the first...
reviews.content: "Home Alone 3" is a Comedy - Crime movie in which we watch an eight-year old boy living in Chicago and has to protect his home by a group of international spies who want to steal a toy of his because it has a computer chip inside it.Since I had already watched the two previous "Home Alone" movies I have to admit that I did not have high expectations from it because I knew that it would not be as good as the first two movies. It had a simple plot and the traps that were created by the child were more evolved than the previous two movies. The direction which was made by Raja Gosnell was below average and he did not reach the potential of the "Home Alone" franchise. The interpretations of Alex D. Linz who played as Alex Pruitt, Rya Kihlstedt who played as Alice Ribbons, Olek Krupa who played as Petr Beaupre and David Thornton who played as Earl Unger followed the steps of the direction without any surprises. Finally, I have to say that "Home Alone 3" is a below average comedy movie and I do not recommend it to anyone who have already watched the two previous movies of the franchise because I believe that you will waste your time.

I liked this movie ok. I will still watch it if it comes on the TV during the Christmas season but it's not rewatchable at other times of the year like the first two films. In my honest opinion, I would've personally like to see a movie similar to the Christmas Story sequel, It Runs in the Family...meaning that it would take place with the original McCallisters but maybe set at a different time of year.

For whatever reason, I cannot understand why exactly people cannot warm to this film as I have done. I have watched the previous two films (the latter I have on VHS), and this is as good as the films that preceded it. I watched this film on Channel Four a few days after Christmas and it was then I began to enjoy it again.It was with this film the series bowed out, as I believe that the fourth "film" (I put it in brackets as it is not a film in the conventional sense of the word) was an atrocity and not worth the time Twentieth Century Fox could have spent to make another film that year. This edition you should savour, as it all went downhill from that point onward.One must be reminded of the period the film was made in: it was 1997, when technology had advanced, and it was admirable that the film's producers took notice of it, with the storyline concerning the computer chip and the producers mentioned the political aspect of that storyline, what with the burglars working for a North Korean terrorist organisation. It is on this basis, I believe that the Home Alone series was also modernised.It is humorous and decently written, and these alone amount for any shortcomings it may have (had). That is why I think the film did it for me. So basically, if you think this film is bad, watch the following film instead. Then you will understand my stance.

this movie is very funny, lots of cool gadgets and a different storyline from the first two home alone films. I like the storyline of the missile chip hidden in a toy car mistakingly falling into the hands of eight year old Alex. The remote controlled car scene is very good, i like all the tricks at the end as well, there very good. The acting in this film is also quite good, especially young Alex playing such a major role at his age, my favourite character in the film is Earl Unger, he's in my opinion the funniest of the gang, i'd love to see the crew back in home alone five trying to rob major electronical stores in Chicago, with Alex (who should make a return) getting in their way!I totally disagree with people who think this movie is a cheap cash-in considered to the rest of the series, i really like this film, it's very enjoyable and i strongly recommend it to anyone who is a fan of any home alone film.

Home Alone 3 was like the stupidest movie I've ever seen. I actually expected it to be like Home Alone 1 & 2, but with a different character in it, but guess what, it was nothing that I expected it to be, it was BORING!! I don't know how they made it so stupid.
My family with 3 young kids very much enjoyed this movie.

Fast past with more traps and gags for the crooks. This is a worthy follow up that doesn't have the original cast. The story is good and the crooks great, in this romp based around the Christmas Season yet again. It good fun for all ages and doesn't disappoint one bit.

First off left me say the kid in this is annoying acts to smart and is unlikeable
Second the crooks are all horrible actors and ver cringey
Third what is with the stupid sound effects every time the bad guys get hurt
Fourth why have a brother and sister is they are like doing nothing in the movie
Fifth I wanna shoot the parrot
Sixth no comedy bad story unlikeable parents and very boring
Seventh I wush i used my 1 hour 37 minutes doing something else
Oh and in every scene the crooks had about 10 or 15 seconds to move out of the way of most of the traps
It might had been the worst movie out of the 4 why did they change Kevin's name I mean better then home alone 4

This movie should not have been made.  It in no way is a sequel.  I finally realized after watching this how Macaulay Culkin is not that bad of an actor after all.  Home Alone was good, Home Alone 2 was also good, but this movie sucks.This kid gets left at home, not mistakenly, because he has the chicken pox. His parents leave on and off, he's not left with a babysitter, and this group of "intelligent high tech" criminals are after his fire truck?  This movie has "This sucks" written all over it.You can probably tell from reading this that I'm not ten years old.  I have to say that I took my nephew to see this a few years back.  I'll tell you this, he would have liked "Boogie Nights" better!  Not to say that Boogie Nights was a bad movie, because it wasn't.  It's just that he fell asleep during this production that should not have ever been considered made.What were the adults in this movie thinking?  NO Macaulay Culkin, no Joe Pesci, no Daniel Stern, no Catherine O'Hara, etc.  Nobody, not even John Hughes or Chris Columbus had anything to do with this movie.  It isn't even worth half a star.  That's all.

They should have stopped when Macaulay Culkin got too old to do the movies anymore. This movie was very horrible. It wasn't funny. The only good Home Alone was the 1st one. I just hope they don't make any more. If they do, I'll scream. 3/10

I think Home Alone 3 is an alright comedy but it can never beat Home Alone or Home Alone 2,but it is better than Home Alone 4.Alex was great and so was the rest of the cast and the boy and girl who were Alex's brother and sister were average. Peter Beaupre: We are going to Chicago. Earl Unger: In the winter? I packed tropical. This second sequel to Home Alone has Alex D. Linz replacing Macualay Culkin as the kid who is left Home Alone and also has a completely different cast.After having the chicken Pox Alex is left home alone and 4 burglars are looking for a chip that that they have hidden in a toy car which ends up to be with Alex for shuffling snow.

reviews.review_title: **:2 out of 5 stars,a grand example of badly-timed sequels.
reviews.content: True we have the same funny hijinx & crazy nearby tool fun,but they took what the 1st two had & litterally threw it away,true macualy culkin really did outgrew the Crook-invading little kid but,but did they really have to replace the wet bandits(Joe pesci,Daniel stern) sure the new crooks were okay for beginners at trying to invade the kids traps but they couldn't compare to the Wet bandits,& the mild sensuality was just low humor-to pathetic attempts to try to get hormone-surged teens to some adults to get interested,1st one when the new kid(Alex D. Linz) fires a li'l toy plunger gun on the Tv screen & it landed right on a female aerobiizer's butt,the 2nd one(the truly pathetic one) is when 1 of the crooks finds & tries to sneak up to a girl in the shower which is actually a (presumably) porno cutout,but remember at least they keep the wacky hijinx alive & well,but that's the only thing they kept alive,everything is basically proof that this is a badly-timed sequel.

Having watched the first 2 Home Alone's when I was a Kid on VHS, I learned from friends that there were (then) 2 more Films in the Franchise & that they weren't any good. I somehow agreed, given that they also said it didn't follow the story of the first 2 & featured different families in them. Anyway, fast forward a few years & I was at a friends house & he had the whole including this film & Home Alone 4 on DVD. When I began to watch the 3rd film, I was actually pleasantly surprised...The film sees 8-Year-Old Alex Pruitt home alone with the Chicken Pox. Elsewhere, a group of International Criminals have recently lost a bag with a Remote Controlled Car containing a Micro Chip stolen from a military Defence Contractor that Alex just so happens to have in his possession. The International Criminals then start to break into each house in Alex's Neighbourhood, but with his family & the police not believing him, it is up to Alex to put a stop to these said criminals & recover the Chip.I found the film to be actually really, really good, if not better than the first 2 films. That's, by the way, not to say the first 2 films suck, because they don't, they're epic classics, don't get me wrong. But this film had better traps, a better story & a less annoying kid this time around.I also like the fact that it's not set during Christmas which like the change in direction overall, with the new family & child lead actor, was pretty refreshing. It's not badly paced & is 92 minutes (1 hour & 32 minutes) long & is pretty entertaining if you give it a chance.The villains were great in this too & with a more serious tone given to them it worked well & the traps, were ace as & didn't disappoint at all & were more creative & brutal than the first 2 films. The lead actor playing Alex was good & less annoying I'd say & more of a sympathetic character as well as the family & his 2 siblings who while were obnoxious to begin with, were likable in the end.I will say the film gets a lot of hate & backlash because it doesn't feature the Mcallisters & of course, Kevin, Marv & Harry. It would've gotten pretty boring if it were the same cast & story. Those slagging this film off would've slagged it off & complained about it being cliche & a retread which the 2nd Home Alone film pretty much did.I think you can only retell the same story over & over before it becomes stale. Culkin was 16 when this was being filmed & would've been 17 on release, so if he were to be in this flick & it were to be the same as the first 2 films, it would'v been a flop, easily. At least this film, unlike the 4th, has John Hughes' magic in it & feels more Home Alone esque unlike the latter 3 films that followed.Overall, this is a very underrated sequel that gets hate simply because it's not the same as the previous 2 films, which I'll admit are classics. But, give this one a chance & enjoy it in its own merit & for what it is. You may or may not like it, but don't listen to those haters who will try & convince you this isn't even worth watching because it is. It's a great story with great traps, villains, family & leading kid.9/10.

I was getting desperate for Christmas classics after running out of National Lampoon and HA 1 and 2 so I sucked it up and tried HA 3. The latter came out in 1997 but looked liked a mid-1980s movie like something out of McGyver. The kid was a Nicolas knock-off from the 1970s. The family car was a Taurus wagon. This movie should not have been called Home Alone or even associated with the franchise without the franchise actors. It just didn't work. Even from the beginning th magic is lost focusing on no-name villains that do nothing to captivate or interest the audience. Those toy cars have been around for decades, nothing novel there. All this movie did is detract from the legacy of the first two. If the intent was to reboot, it didn't work. National Lampoon would not have done a movie this bad. Suspect this was just a left over script from the 80s, not a true HA sequel. It barely mentioned Christmas and pandered to teenage pop. You get the impression the director didn't know where to go with the movie, which isn't fair to the actors. This movie committed the unforgivable sin of ignoring Christmas - a secular and empty cartoon. Don't recommend.

We should be very aware of Little Alex, he is capable of bringing an entire empire to its knees without even breaking a sweat.The kid's a beast!All jokes aside, the film is quite fun, especially with all those neatly designed traps. I loved the way they were implemented. The writing did miss out on the magic its predecessors have had earlier but I must say, as a standalone this isn't terrible at all! Yeah, it defies logic, and the script is ridden with loopholes but who would expect to get rationality from movies that are specifically made for little kids and teenagers?Enjoy its peculiarities and you will have a good time.

This movie would likely be hated by fans from the first 2 Home Alone's, but even though I like the first 2, this wasn't so bad in fact kind of good. This movie is too under rated, because I liked it. Here are some pro's and cons for this movie:Cons: This doesn't have Kevin or any of the characters of the first 2 in it and the characters aren't as good. This would've been better with Kevin in it.This movie wasn't that interesting in the middle, so they should of reduced boring parts.This movie had new actors that weren't as good as the originalI wish it wasn't so high-tech, because this looks a little too modernThere wasn't much humor in this onePros:The booby traps were pretty neat. Just as good as the first 2.Even if it's more modern, the computer chip part of the movie is pretty cool.The parts with action in it are good. I couldn't get enough of itIt was still pretty original, even if it's high tech (John Hughes created this as well!)Overall, even with the con's, this movie was watchable. It wasn't great, but still a movie I can watch. This one get's a 6/10

This film is a great film and if the other two previous films hadn't existed I bet this would be considered a childhood nostalgic classic. Alas the greatest of it's predecessors and the odd removal from the franchise means it has been relegated at least in the eyes of the majority to a mere 4.something on IMDb, a sad sentence for such a good film. They definitely went for something different with this one and I think it worked, and well.
Why did they need a 3rd Home Alone movie? We'll never know. That being said, it's a decent kid friendly family movie about stopping bad guys with toys and gadgets.

reviews.review_title: What is wrong with all of you??
reviews.content: What is wrong with all of you? This has to be one of the worst movies I have ever seen in my life. I'm sick from the amount of comments that say that this is a good story. Four spies can't handle a little kid. I think its pretty amusing that most of the kid's traps work and that he has the ability to make all of that stuff, and without his mom noticing. Come on, the first one was funny and a good idea, the second was the obligatory sequel that seems to happen to often these days (Scream 3, I still know blah blah blah). But this one, I watch it and am speechless. Not to be nit-picky, but wouldn't a plastic arrow gun weigh a little less than a real glock, and I think its interesting how the kid knows what kind of guns they will have. If I could I would give it a -6, but on a scale of 0-10, I'd have to give it a 0.
The sequel was but and now this why do I think there well be another sequel

reviews.review_title: Are you all kidding me? This movie was complete GARBAGE!
reviews.content: I don't know what you guys are inhaling, but please stop. This movie was complete trash.Macaulay Culkin as Kevin McCallister was lovable, cute, sweet, loving, and extremely fun to watch. He had that innocence but at the same time, he was strong as well.This new kid, Alex? Annoying as all hell! Just a blatant ripoff at trying to match Culkin's charm and grace, failing miserably at that.The villains, complete crap. Harry and Marv, they were such an entertaining on screen team. They were comedic, they were humorous, and just made you really want to root for Culkin even more, which is what a good villain is suppose to do. These guys Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern, absolutely PERFECT for those roles. On the other hand, in 3, we have 4 new idiots that just bicker and again, try to capitalize on the charisma and duo charm of the first villains. Not saying they were horrible, but they were not memorable or even really that entertaining. More on the corny side actually.Then we got the actual movies. Part 1 and 2, classics. Memorable. Perfect to watch around Christmas and brings a wonderful Christmas feeling and brings out so many emotions. It makes you fall in love with the story, and care about the characters. Simply, memorable and close to being masterpieces. Part 3? Masterpiece of crap. Enough said.All and all, I don't know why people like this. I think people really don't know what a good movie is anymore. Its a crappy sequel rip-off with more unrealistic traps and a stupid new main character kid that I wish the robbers would of at least beat the crap out of.Run, run away from this garbage. And lets not even start with Part 4!

The actual "Home Alone 2" is what I DESPISE about sequels: the same people, the same things, happening at the same time of year even (in this case, Christmas)...the only real difference being the location. I think John McClane said it best in "Die Hard 2" (another repetitive, unnecessary deja vu sequel) in a great meta moment: "How can the same s*** happen to the same guy twice?". The worst part about "Home Alone 2" is it's actually a misnomer, for, as Marv states "This ain't like the last time. This ain't his house"...in other words, Kevin is only alone, NOT home. That's why I think this movie actually works BETTER as the sequel! You've got the same basic premise that worked so well in the original (a kid is left alone in his OWN home to defend it against invading bad guys with clever traps) but it's changed JUST enough to make the sequel its own movie, able to stand on its own (new cast; first kid is left home accidentally & second kid is home from school sick, new & improves traps- including a TV gag that's actually plausible, still winter but not Christmas). Based on many of the other comments here, the biggest problems the naysayers have are that it's a different family and the movie doesn't happen at Christmas. However, in my book, those are two of the main reasons this movie is actual BETTER!

Whoever thought that ANOTHER Home Alone film would be a good idea should have their head examined... Same plot, different kid, more villains (which leads to MORE endless stupidity in the traps).  The other two films were bad enough, and this is where it hits rock bottom.  People may as well watch the other films for plot, as it's all identical.

reviews.review_title: A stain upon the Hone Alone franchise
reviews.content: The movie only works if you are four years old. Doesn't feel like a Christmas Movie at all. The gags are forced, the humor doesn't land. Nothing like Home Alone 1 and 2.

reviews.review_title: this film don't make sense but...
reviews.content: This film is fun to watch..pros:Alex is not as wild as Kevin,this film is fun to watch,double the amounts of villains as the earlier two movies makes his plans more challenging.so Alex has a backup bird and mice to help him out.cons:the boy is sick throughout the movie making his mom more protective and harder to be alone,his mom wont let him be alone until the day he sets up plans which gives him less alone time which is 30 minutes less then the time Kevin was given which was an hour during the film.So this film is not bad.and Alex is better then Kevin.so there's 4 pros.2 cons.+4,-2.

reviews.review_title: Alex is target by four international terrorists, in one of the most thrilling action movies ever made.
reviews.content: What can be said about Home Alone 3 apart from it being the greatest film of all time? The fact that it didn't win every single Oscar in 1997 is a downright outrage. The reason is due to the fact that Macaulay Culkin ruined the franchise in the first two films, before Alex D. Linz was tasked with salvaging the remnants.When four terrorists target Alex while he is off school, he outwits and outmatches them. The main competitive advantage Home Alone 3 brings to the table is the fact that there are four villains. This means that there are more traps, more action, more laughs and more enjoyment.Furthermore, the role of Alex's sister was the role that launched the career of Scarlett Johansson. Without this movie, it is safe to say that she would have had no part in the Avengers, Hancock, and most importantly, the Spongebob Squarepants Movie.There was a lot of hype surrounding this movie, and it lived up to all reviews. 10/10, an act of pure class.

reviews.review_title: Come on, this was a pure JOKE!!
reviews.content: Now I love the First 2, the 1st being a genuine all-time, funny as hell classic, the 2nd one being OK, but this 3rd sequel??? I'm almost at a loss of words. First, it has nothing to do with 1 or 2, so why even name it Home Alone?? Second, the funny Culkin was 100 times more creative, loving, smarter, and down right funnier than that annoying, wanna-be bad ass kid. Third, the criminal characters in the first two were well created, as well as the plots, not to mention funnier. These foreign terrorists?? A joke. The story had no good plot, and acting sucked, unlike the first 2. A joke for a sequel to one of the best series made in Hollywood.

reviews.review_title: Pretty awful film that has a fun finale
reviews.content: Home Alone 3 is grim, the acting is horrible and the main boy is incredibly irritating. It has a couple of things going for it, Aleksander Krupa is a good villain and the end sequence where they break into the house (again) was fairly fun if a bit too silly.3/10: Not great

reviews.review_title: good, but doesn't belong in the home alone franchise.
reviews.content: Yes, this certainly wasn't a bad movie as people have made it out to be. It's actually pretty good, but it doesn't qualify as a Home Alone. The movie still should of been made, but it should go as a Dennis the Menace. The old lady next door wouldn't be in it. They change her character to Mr. Wilson, and yes Waler Mathau would be playing him. He would still be alive in 97. My sympathy goes out to his family.  He was truly a great comedian, especially in both Grumpy Old Men movies. But back to Home Alone 3. It was good, but from now on I'll call it Dennis the Menace 2. Rating 6/10. Why 6/10? Because of it being named as a home alone.

The movie is called "Home Alone 3" but Home Alone resides only in the title. In fact, the Home Alone term shouldn't be used in the title anyway. It should be used to define the genre or the sub-genre or the sub-sub-genre of this movie. The only other similarity is the presence of producer John Hughes, who also produced the first two Home Alone movies.Other than these two little facts, "Home Alone 3" shares nothing with its predecessors. The lead character (and actor de facto) is different, the antagonists are different and the story is very different.Macaulay Culkin left his place to Alex D. Linz, who plays Alex (not too difficult, isn't it?), a small boy who lives in Chicago suburbia and has just caught chicken pox.The result is that he has to stay home while his brother and sister (who's played by young Scarlett Johansson) go to school and his parents go to work. His mother can't find a baby-sitter so Alex is left home alone (understood?).What you'd expect from that successful series effectively happens: a group of burglars (this time four, not two) are searching for a missing microchip and they attempt to find it in Alex's neighborhood.Alex calls police twice when he witnesses the burglars' actions but they escape each time, so Alex is accused of making prank calls. In order to clear his name (if I can say it this way), Alex intends to catch the burglars by himself and by booby-trapping his house (surprised?), which is supposed to be next house on the list because the burglars go house by house.Because this is the third movie of an already exhausted film series, the result is exactly what you'd expect. The movie is unoriginal, unfunny and cannot work.The actors are incredibly bad. Alex D. Linz doesn't deliver the job very well and all of the other actors act in a foreseeable way and look like typical movie stereotypes.The villains aren't exactly a disaster because they deliver fair laughs when they need to. I particularly liked Rya Kihlstedt whose portrayal of the nasty girl with black hair gives some gravity. Olek Krupa's performance as burglar chief Beaupre isn't so bad neither.The movie is so bad because it has absolutely everything it needs to be classed as a 'turn-your-brain-off' movie.The storyline is less than weak, the logic is totally absent and the conveyed humor is totally inappropriate. It is supposed to be a family movie but it has more gross-out humor than any other form of comedy, including the legendary slapstick, which makes that kind of film so funny.However, when the coveted slapstick moments finally happen, the movie becomes really funny.
