Unfortunately, these kind of comic pieces don't work so well in film and should be presented as a series of sketches. I can't understand how a eight-year old boy could set all this in a single night and how he could know the working of every tool he uses. I can't figure how his parents or his brother and sister don't wake up in the middle of the night because of the noises. But frankly, am I supposed to ask all of these questions? "Home Alone 3" is directed by Raja Gosnell, a film editor whose previous works include "Good Morning, Vietnam" and "Pretty Woman". I guess he got his first directing job because he also was the editor of the first two "Home Alone" movies and he frequently worked with director Chris Columbus. But Gosnell shows that he's not very good in directing and he would also prove us several times in the future with movies like "Big Momma's House" and "Scooby-Doo". His views of comedy don't work here, but he just seems to follow the logic that this movie will be a success only by the title name. In other words, another commercially-minded director. So sad.I would say that the only merit that this movie have is that it shows actors who shouldn't be cast in any other movie due to their low skills.So please, stop the series. We've got too much of it now.
In my eyes this should be a completely different film. I actually can't believe they made this.

This is not a sequel to the first two Home Alone movies. It is a ripoff, and not even a good one. You have a different kid and different villians. Nothing is the same as the first two movies, except these actors (if you can even call them that) doing bad imitations of the action of the first two films. Alex Linz is a flop. You can even tell that he was attempting to imitate Macaulay Culkin. The villians are completely unfunny, uninteresting and unappealing. Also, why were there four villians here? Twice as much of something bad doesn't make any of it good. Some film critics denounced the first two movies, and actually rated this one a little higher. Give me a break! What was their point? A movie that's boring and stupid is better than a movie that entertains you and makes you laugh? I've watched the first two movies a few times. I wish I'd never heard of part 3.

This one is the in between film, number 4 was just an embarrassment and heist and the new one aren't much better, whilst 1/2 are obviously way out ahead for nostalgia I actually don't think this one is a bad film.If timing was different this could've been more well received or if it hadn't have been part of their HA franchise. As a stand alone there are definite wins for 3 for some of the best moments of the series.I like the storyline, it was more fleshed out and suited the cheesy 90s era, from music to presentation I liked that, whilst Harry and especially Marv are iconic I don't think they had much to work with. Here the 4 protagonists are a mixed bag, the leader plays the part well, the long haired guy was presented like marv was and the other guy for me was a bit redundant. However the lady playing Alice was excellent, from mannerisms to comedic timing I thought she made this movie.Family wise it felt more natural, the kids in the original aren't good at acting, the family scenes felt more real yet again the dad has minimal impact, does the writer have daddy issues? Whilst the family is hard to compare as neither did much, when I objectively thought about the two kids, I actually preferred Alex, he felt more of a real kid, although Kevin has a piece of my heart I just felt this was more akin to being a child. Whilst neither are superb actors, this felt more natural again.The pranks felt more realistic where Kevin's Would take hours to prepare, these were more brutal, creative and fun, I hate panning away and not seeing the impact but I guess it would not look great. Some of the ones in this were even better than the big 2.I'm unsure about the team behind the franchise and their motive, you read in 4 they reached out to marv who literally tore the film apart and then they just recast him but dressed him as Harry, the obsession with the older angry looking adult who always turns out nice, there's a lot of lazy writing and stale components.If this had have come out under a different name itd be sitting on a 7 atleast.
Home Alone 3. Where is Kevin ?! Not a bad family comedy and soft sequel to the Homeless Children franchise. The protagonist coped well with his role, and the traps are still inventive.

Look, Home Alone 3 doesn't stack up to Home Alone 2 (my favourite) or the iconic original, but it also isn't deserving of some of the scratching and harsh reviews I've read. John Hughes was still on board, and that's a good sign in my book. The plot is almost identical to it's two predecessors, though with a slight twist on the 'kid home alone' scenario, Alex D. Linz plays Alex, who is basically Kevin McAlister with a different name, the bad guys - whilst not dim-witted local burglars this time around - are as bumbling as ever. The booby traps are advanced, there are some funny moments, and Home Alone 3 might be the first major role for future Hollywood star Scarlett Johansson. There are enough laughs in Home Alone 3 to keep you entertained.

A load of trash like the series which preceded it.  Any one who laughs at this should see a psychiatrist as soon as possible.  I sat through this garbage and did not smile once.   My wife could not believe that I could sit through it, she saw five minutes of it then went to bed. However, as I pointed out to her, you cannot be critical if you have not seen it.   TRASH personified.

Macaulay Culkin wasn't there, which makes it a feel like a B movie, even though it is an A level budget.Sorry not everyone is replaceable. Sometimes when the actor moves on the franchise needs to do the same #FastFuriousBut to get back on track with this movie, just watch something else. Product of it's time which isn't interesting.

reviews.review_title: The next Kevin McCallister? Not Likely... (Spoiler!!!)
reviews.content: Please Note: This has some material that may Qualify as "Spoiler" Material, So if you hav'nt seen this Movie, Thank God!!! : This movie, though was fun to watch, Did Not have the same Unique Charm of the First Two. Culkin was of course 14, 15 or 16 when Shooting started, But That is no reason to switch it with This Brat! They should have thought Ahead!!! Home Alone 3 would have been much better if not for The Burglers! If Harry and Marv came back, and Culkin Guest starred or Something, It would be Perfect... also, whetever happened to the Spoofs in the First two Movies? Like the Main Character meeting a Scary Person, then making Friends? Or the "Angels with Filthy Souls" gag, or a Family member getting mad at him as soon as they got back? And what is up with him being "Home Alone" With the Friggen "Chicken Pox!!??" That is NOT a real "Home Alone" Way to do it!!!  I Guess the McCallisters have no Place in Home Alone History anymore.. Pity... you can just forget about Home Alone 5.. (Home Alone 4 was something that was on TV.) P.S. Please Forgive my Bitching.. ^_^

reviews.review_title: Now there are four burglars, not just two!
reviews.content: I like this one because it is not so sugary sweet as the first two Home Alone films.  The boy who plays Alex might not be as good as Macaulay Culkin, but it still delivers the laughs as the four spies get their just desserts!

This movie is not a great cinematic work, nor does it pretend to be.  If anybody viewed this film expecting otherwise, the movie should not be blamed. Right from the start, major suspension of disbelief is required. Having said that, it was adequately entertaining.
If someone loves 1st and 2nd part and because the old crew is not here they are giving bad reviews then mehhh! For me and my buddies 3rd part is the best one!!!

I don't like this movie but I don't hate it either. I have fond memories from watching it on VHS as a child and I decided to rewatch it this Christmas. I can honestly say I laughed more than I thought I would. Some of the jokes actually landed and the traps was pretty creative. As for the kid who set them.. They portrayed him as a kid genius with an IQ of 250 and I didn't really buy it. I didn't believe he was as clever and cunning as the creators wanted me to believe.And the villains overplayed their roles.. Honestly it was painful to watch most of the time. Yes, the characters from the original movies was always over the top but still within reason... And they had charm.. Something this one was sorely lacking.Despite all this I don't hate this movie, I would place it somewhere between mediocre and bad. I have seen lots of horrible movies in my life and I actually find this one tolerable.

What was John Hughes thinking? Shocking film that held none of the magic or adventure of the first 2. I watched all three in succession with my family and held no expectations at all for this one..... luckily, cos it was an absolute bludger and way to complicated for 3-6 year old kids

Now, I can see that this film has a very low average and I'm guessing that it's because it's the third in the series of Home Alone movies and maybe because of the change of actors, especially the main actor, Alex.I however, saw this movie before the other Home Alone movies, I was about 12 years old at the time and I absolutely loved it. I remember laughing so much my stomach hurt, literally. I saw it again just now and well, my opinion hasn't changed. The plot was good and the villains were awesome, especially after their little accidents lol..I don't know how it would be if I had seen this as the third in the series but as a stand-alone film, it was extremely enjoyable and very entertaining. I would definitely suggest it if you want a good, light-hearted comedy coz this is quite perfect. Enjoy!

I really like the Movie, it has an original story there's 4 villain's now. Good music, And a new child. But Alex D Linz can't beat Macaulay Culkin. The parrot was funny, so Home Alone 4 makes Home alone 3 look better. I prefer Home Alone 1 and 2 though. I Liked the part when Mr. Jernigan gets smacked in the weenie. (End Of Review)

I just watched this for the first time trying to accept it because I like the first two so much. The film misses out on the warmth and coziness people search for on Christmas. All the classic, comedy based ones do, especially 1 & 2. Home alone three is more like Dennis the Menace saves The neighborhood during winter time.

reviews.review_title: You'll love it if you thought the other 2 were okay
reviews.content: -Honestly, this kid's an improvement: he's not a brat, much easier to sympathize with, and doesn't have terribly neglectful parents that take you out of the experience. C'mon guys.-Really improved everything about the franchise: Made a much more believable and understandable family situation for modern audiences. Made this kid a hilarious 5D chess thinking little twerp that can outdo a group of specially trained Korean spies, while suffering from chicken pox! If this kid gets any more strong, the world is basically doomed and I love it. Put a lot more time and effort into the traps and pranks over the story, which I really preferred in the last movie too. Has a lighter but also more high-stakes story which I think fits perfectly.-Just hilarious, but more hilarious for the ridiculousness.-Pranks are also much more memorable, because they were SUPER clever and painful.-It's a Home Alone sequel. I'm not gonna watch it out of season, but I'll admit it is good for it's genre.

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the 2nd Home Alone but still good.
reviews.content: This film isn't as good as the 2nd one but it's still a good movie. When five year old whiz kid Alex discovers 3 burglars he calls the police but they won't believe him. So he calls the burglar's home and let's his parrot do the talking. In the middle since the police didn't believe him he calls the FBI and they find out there are burglars. Alex finds out there's a chip hidden in a toy car. He has an older brother and an older sister that are always picking on him. At the end the FBI and police give Alex a reward.

You guys have no eyes. this is brilliant. i have myself laughing out loud at a lot of the scenes. i do find the replacement of the charming Kevin to be a bad idea but it is executed perfectly. the traps are interesting and funny. One of the bad things about this is that its not as replayable as the first one.

It's not exactly as good as the first two, but not unpleasant. I happen to have an interest in B- movies and this movie doesn't qualify. Of course, it has elements that are criterion for such movies, but many movies do too. The first two Home Alone films are not exempt either. All else aside, I liked the different plot that it had. Sure, international terrorists in a kids movie are not what we consider to be pleasant, but it staged a more intense feeling. The fact that Alex's parents did not believe him at first was very interesting. That was definitely something that stood out from the first two. Most people probably don't like it because Kevin is not in it. The mechanics of the movie (lighting, sound effects, voices, etc.) appear to be up to expectations. Everyone's a critic on acting, so I am not going to give my opinion on the actors.So what if Kevin isn't the main character anymore? That's my opinion, at least. It's different, sure, but still nonetheless good.

This movie is different than the other 2 movies. This time the boy is sick at home while the parents are working. He's not really home alone.  This is a stupid non-sequel to the home alone movies with a all-new different cast. The movie is pretty much the same, people getting hurt by wire booby traps that a little kid set up. There is nothing funny about this movie. If you watch the last two movies, there is no point to watch this film. It's a waste of time.I give this film 3 out of 10

This movie is really great. I am giving my first review only because of the 1&2 fan boys. I see so many posts liking this movie better than 1&2 and some always calls them morons or something and some one even going on to want to blow this movie's kid's brain. PATHETIC.. This movie is on par or better then 1 and way better than 2. HA2 was just a complete step by step copy cat of 1. At-least 3 has a reasonable family. Both 1&2 had a family that never believes in Kevin and some idiotic and cheesy brother apologizing scenes.1&2 lovers, If you cant like this film just shut up. Don't go on meddling with every fans of this movie,A rating <4 ??? unbelievable. This should be 6-7.

If the movie had a different title it would help. Home Alone 3 is not a sequel to the first two Home Alone movies.Unlike the first two movies, in this Home Alone, Alex is alone at times but his mother, brother and sister are in and out of the house.....the father is there as well.It is funny and amusing at times. The animals in it, a mouse and a talking Parrot are funny also.With four villains to stop there are lot of good scenes to watch and laugh at.The camera angles from the toy cars view are really good.The one odd thing was that the boy playing Alex reminded me of a creepy looking Adam Rich! (of Eight is Enough fame)

reviews.review_title: An Insult to the first 2 movies
reviews.content: First off there is no such thing as Home Alone 3 most people including me pretend this doesn't exist how is it home alone 3 when none of the people from the first 2 are not in it makes no sense and I tired to see what it's like but its boring no Macaulay Culkin Joe Pesci or Dan stern then it's not Home Alone !

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as people say it is
reviews.content: This movie was surprisingly good! Yes, it's not as good as the classic first 2 Home Alone movies, but it's not terrible and as bad as people make it out to be, it's funny and everything a family movie should be. Give it a go!

reviews.review_title: Quite possibly the most disappointing sequel of all time!
reviews.content: I loved the first two Home Alone movies, I think they are among my favorite comedies. So when I heard there was a Home Alone 3 coming out, I was excited. But when I heard nobody from the first two are in it, I was really let down, but still looking forward to seeing it. I watched the previews for it and I thought they looked very bad. So I was planning on not seeing the movie....until I was convinced by Roger Ebert to see it. I always wondered why he hated the first two, and I was curious at to why he liked this one. So I went thinking it could be good...what was I thinking?? This is such an incredibly terrible movie. Not a single laugh in it, not one. I don't even think I can even consider this movie a sequel. It has no resemblance to the originals, it looks more like a wannabe. And it fails miserably when it comes to laughs and charms. This movie is easily forgettable and it's probably the worst comedy sequel of all time...probably even a candidate for worst sequel of all time. I can't even give this movie half a star it was so bad
This movie is so funny an so good! :) little alex is adorable and is a genius at fighting off bad guys!! My 5 year old son loves it !

I can't understand why anyone compares this "Home Alone" with previous two movies. I can't even understand why they named it "Home Alone" at all. This one has nothing common with first and second movie, except that first and this one are set in same town. The story is entirely different, the boy's family is different. Exactly as first and second "Home Alone" main character - 8 years old Alex has to stop four criminals to complete their mission, but this time they are four instead 2. They are international criminals from very high rang. They have high tech equipment, they are very well trained and with huge experience. As you can see in some moments their work is perfect. They don't left any traces. They are not just some local idiots like in first two movies. The 8 years old Alex is not just forgotten from his family like first "Home Alone". He is left alone in the house, cuz he is sick.
Entire story looks more real and authentic. This is entirely different story and as i mentioned i can't understand why they named that "Home Alone". First two movies are great, but this one is better and it shouldn't be compare with previous, cuz it is not like them. This is not sequel for first and second movie. This is new story, new movie. I knew that before i saw it and that's why i wasn't disappointed from this one. I liked it very much, even more than "Home Alone" 1 and 2.

People always get use to nostalgia and prefer the original, and stubbornly accept that any reboot or sequel with a different cast is worst.For starter Alex is way better than Kevin, 1 vs 4 enemy, even Kevin always have help from another ally.And the pace of this movie is perfect. The villains origin are quickly showcase, and how they are shown to be intimidated and real, unlike the Wet Bandits who's a Joke.The action/pranks are greatly done. The remote control car action on the second act was nicely done. And honestly, think the pranks for the third act was better than both Home Alone, and it was about 30 minutes long. That's tons of action.Plus, you have Scarlet Johansson.

reviews.review_title: This film is not bad but should have been the last in the franchise
reviews.content: The bad ratings are just from disgruntled people comparing it to the original, in a stand alone sense the film has an interesting plot and a fresh take on usual home alone-esque movies.The kid (Alex) is actually more likeable in my opinion than Kevin as he doesn't really come off as a spoiled brat... The villains are also a great part of the movie this time being sophisticated spies as opposed to street hoods and are played by fantastic actors. The part everyone wants to know about (the traps) certainly doesn't disappoint.Overall despite the fact it will never beat the first two films this is a great sequal, something I can't say for the following movies in the franchise.Unfortunately, I don't think we will ever see an end to home alone spin offs as the plot line is pretty timeless...kid beats up bad guys!

What the heck is this crap?  The first two home alone movies were good, but this one sucked.  What's the point of doing a Home Alone 3 with a different cast?  I don't like Macauley Culkin anyway, but he's the star of the first two films and he can't be replaced.  Neither can the rest of the cast.  I can't believe people are actually wondering about a Home Alone 4.  That will never happen.  If it does, I guarentee it will lose money.  They'll have to pay people just to see it, because Home Alone 3 was so bad.

A top-secret computer chip has been stolen from the U.S. Defense Department. The international criminals who expertly and ruthlessly engineered its heist are asking for untold millions of dollars on the Black Market. But the precious booty, hidden inside a toy car, has been temporarily misplaced. Its final destination: a comfortable Chicago suburb.Quietly taking up residence in the tree-lined neighborhood, the four highly trained spies marshal all their diabolical resources and skills to retrieve the device. Their state-of-the-art surveillance and ruthless strategy have foiled Interpol, the FBI, U.S. Defense agents and the local police. Only one person can stop this high-tech gang of black marketers, eight year-old Alex Pruitt. When this pesky team of bad guys invade his neighborhood, he's the last and only line of defense. Alex has his own special surveillance tools. He has his own carefully mapped out strategy. He has courage. He has the chicken pox. And he's Home Alone...

My favorite Christmas movie. It's so wholesome, the characters are amazing. I like this family more than the McAllisters too. They really should've named it something else so that people wouldn't leave bad reviews just for the association. But it's so cute as a stand alone movie.

I'm shocked after seeing the poor rating...
This movie is really very funny and definitely kids gonna love this movie so much..
I feel it's better than previous movies.

I loved the first two movies, but this movie was just a waste of time and money (for me and the studio). I'm still wondering why they made this horrible movie. The thing with the plastic gun and with the toy car, that can go into another house are ridiculous. Joe Pesci and Daniel  Stern in the first two movies were so funny, but the terrorists in this one are so stupid and not funny. Believe me this movie is just a waste of time.

As the title states we once again see the same type of character with the same type of bad guys in the same type of environment.The story gives almost nothing new to the sequels. Kid gets left home alone by accident, some Burglars/Crooks/Spies seek to a point go after the kid.It feels like they really didn't try to make this more exciting or different in any way. It's just a lesser version copy of Home Alone that copied the same antics we saw in the first two films. The overall acting reaches Disney standards but nothing really comical.It has a few moments but it feels a copy of the existing sequels before it.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as I expected
reviews.content:
There are some good things with this movie and some badGOOD- The story: the story is about 4 bad guys that stole something and hit it ina toy car. The toy car gets taken to Alex's (The protagonist) house.
 -The traps: The traps were quite entertaining in my opinionBAD- The charecters: What happened? In Home Alone 2, Kevin was 10, and Alex is 8? Also, why is the protagonist's name Alex? Why couldn't it be Kevin?In this movie, this time there are bad guys instead of 2.

i liked this movie very much because it was funny and always kept you guessing who was going to get whacked over the head with something next. i really like it when movies do that to people. i also liked that this movie had a really good ending, the bad guys going to jail, and the good guy, being this case,Alex, getting what he thought he rightfully earned, RESPECT! respect is not given, it is earned and i think this movie really helps you see what that really is all about. i think a lot more movies should be this way in the future. more laughs and less pain. old fashion fun is what i'm all about. i think all people are like that at some point in their life.

Whole new cast, setting, even just *after* Christmas! Enjoyed this new look, lots of humor and hijinks. The four villains were hilarious. And the mouse and parrot added to the story. The new young boy character was fun to watch. Neat movie.
This movie is so amazing at first I did not want to watch it because I did not think that I would like it but it is amazing and hilarious and perfect for the family

Home Alone 3 was an enjoyable come-back into the Home Alone Series!
This was funny, inspirational, full of action and traps. Incredible cast. Alex D. Linz job enjoyed watching him on screen, he owned every moment. This one is must see and own. A big thanks to Raja Gosnell and John Hughes for creating Home Alone 3 another family classic.

I rent Home Alone 2 DVD and there are three trailer for 1~3. However, there is no point to make sequel after Home Alone 2! Maybe they run out of their idea and they need more profit but the result is disappointing. It's unfair for Alex D. Linz, he's a good child actor and it's a pity he played the wrong movie.

This movie is downright painful to watch.  Any movie that makes you long for Home Alone or the awful sequel has reached new lows.  Take the worst part of the first two (cardboard characters, didactic dialogue, pointless plot) and make it even worse with new villains.  Gone are the bumbling burglars who only committed property crimes.  Now we have four malicious characters who terrorize an old woman, attempt to murder who they believe is a potential witness, and GUESS WHAT ELSE KIDS!  There's GUNS in this one!  No one ever shoots any of them, but they are drawn and pointed all over the place. How's that for wacky hijinks?  Do yourself a favor and leave this home alone.
This movie isn't great, but isn't terrible. It's def more advanced then the first 2 movies. The first 2 are definitely better but this is an ok movie. Again, nothing special.

I have to review this title purely for the fact that the first 2 films were brilliant and the 3rd and 4th are an insult to the originals. When I say review, I don't actually mean review because the only thing I can think of is bad, terrible and one of the worst movies I've ever seen along with Batman & Robin. The story is the same but the burglars are a parody an do some of the worst acting I have ever seen. When you consider the flawless acting of Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern in Home Alone 1 & 2 it's such a shame that they made the next two so badly.Please don't waste your time with the 3rd and 4th just stick the 1st and 2nd on instead. I give it a generous 1.

I loved the first two home alone movies. I loved Kevin. Macauley Culkin was very good in them. I loved the burglars, they were hilarious. I heard nothing good about this one so I never bothered watching it. Then a few days ago while I was in class my teacher put it on. No one in my class was laughing. That kid annoyed the hell out of me and that stupid parrot. I hate that parrot so much. He wasn't funny at all. He was probably the worst thing about this movie and that's saying something. I don't agree with animal cruelty but I just wanted to snap that parrots neck. What actors actually read the script and thought " this is funny and it's as good as the first two i'll do it". And why would John Hughes want anything to do with it. Macauley Culkin must have felt so insulted after seeing this. I wonder if Alex D Linz regrets this movie. Just imagine being Alex D Linz and looking back on this.

reviews.review_title: If you want intelligence, look elsewhere. But show it to the 5-year-old kid you are baby-sitting. It will be an excellent diversion.
reviews.content: There is really no reason to flame this movie for its lack of intelligence. Only a moron will seek intelligence in a movie of this kind. Show this movie to the 5-year-old kid you are baby sitting and it will be an excellent diversion that will let you concentrate on the work on your laptop. In fact, I think IMDB and Amazon.com could do worse than have a category of movies labled "baby-sitting". "Pokemon" and "Home Alone" series will top the list. These movies do not entertain grown-ups, but they serve the purpose you are renting them out for.

The movie was fun from start to finish.  The plot WAS different this time. It was WAY better than the first two by far.  This one contained originality that the others lacked.  (Who has a huge family, outrageous pizza bills, going on a huge vacation and a mansion?)  Not many do.  I reccomend this for a nice laugh and great thrills.

I dont think this is that bad. it has its good points and its bad points. good point alex d linz. bad point not as funny bad guys.good point: more belivable. bad point: a bit boring at times. overall i give this 3 stars.

When viewing this movie, you cannot view it as part of the first two movie's universe. It wasn't meant to be. It not only has different actors, but they also have different names.Seen as its own movie, it is a load of fun for everyone. The slapstick is hilarious, you see Black Widow as a teenager, and the movie even predicted FPV camera tech!Alex's problems are relatable too. The chicken pox are bad enough. One of the most frustrating things as a kid is when adults don't trust you. The moment where his mother says "Look through the telescope long enough you're gonna start seeing things, whether or not they're there." It felt like a more harsh "You'll shoot your eye out" to me.Yes, this movie is a childhood favorite. I still swear by it. 7/10 because sure, it's not better than the first two. Why the comparison though? It may have the Home Alone branding, but it is its own movie. Go watch it this winter. At the very least, it'll surprise you with its charm, humor, and fun.

Quote from my 6 year old "this was the best movie in the history of the world". They particularly liked the remote control car scenes and thought the acting was surprisingly good. The booby traps were as good and funny as the first movie.
This is a movie to watch when you don't want to think too much. It is a light, funny movie for all the family.

I think this movie is overrated by many people. This movie (in my eyes) should be rated PG-13 because it has inappropriate content and crude humor. The movie is also just bad. I think the story is awful. They just leave an 8 yr old boy home alone with chicken pox? I mean come on. There are 2 things wrong with that.
1. He is 8 yrs old
2. He is sick!
Like come on.

reviews.review_title: Underrated, My Favourite Of The Home Alone Movies.
reviews.content: Yes.. yes I know, it isn't as classic as the first Home Alone. Yes there's no Macaulay Culkin. The first movie has a nostalgic warmth and comfort, the same as a familiar bed or blanket or room. But for me, I watched this one the most as a kid and there for the nostalgia is strong. But even now as an adult, I enjoy this film. The plot is the best of the three (we don't talk about what came after three). I find Home Alone 2's plot just way too unbelievable and even though there are plot elements in three that are far fetched I just find it more watchable now as an adult. The booby traps are also far more funnier in my opinion and I like the idea of him trying to capture the crooks on film using his R. C car, however daft that may be. Plus Alex. D. Linz does a fine job.

Forced unfunny plot and the new star was a dud.
Dreck.

reviews.review_title: This movie is one of the best movies that I have seen
reviews.content: This sequel is like part 1 except theres a new boy whose name is Alex and he has the chicken pocks and has to stay home from school.  But if this is really the sequel to Home Alone then wears Macaulay Culkin wears Joe Pesci, Danial Stern, John Heard and Catherine O Hara?  Im sorry to say this but this just is not the sequel to Home Alone 1&2.

reviews.review_title: If you like the first two, don't bother with this one.
reviews.content: I've been a fan of the first two Home Alone movies my whole life, and this third one just doesn't measure up. They repeat many of the same pranks/traps as the first two, so it's unoriginal. Also, there are so many moments that are just too ridiculous to be believable. They're really stretching when they try to do something funny and it's just not working.
Sure it was a mass of stupidity, but I don't think we really are SUPPOSED to like it. I mean, it really is more of a kid's movie.

I've watched every Home Alone movie, and for me, the first two were the best, now they are creating new characters, and those characters are awful, mix that up a little, and you get Home Alone 3. Home Alone 3 sucked so bad that I can't believe I watched it. I do not recommend you to watch this movie, maybe you should rent it, but if you're 8 or higher, you will dislike this movie, I guarantee it. Here's why:I'M NOT GONNA GIVE AWAY ANY MAYOR SPOILERS SO I'M JUST GONNA BE QUICK,Alex Pruitt is an 8 year old boy who is shown as a genius, he is presented in the movie like he's smarter than any member of his family, and also he's smarter than the so called 'spies'. The four spies are easily fooled into traps that our legendary genius, Alex, built. Even an MIT student wouldn't know how to build traps that Alex built. I think our great hero Alex taught us many things, and mostly he taught us NOT to watch this movie. Alex certainly is smart...For those too lazy to read all of this, here's some pros and cons.PROS: --It's a kid's movie; Somewhat funny moments-- CONS: --Alex is a genius; Bad performance, presentation and film direction; The spies are idiots that are not capable of even shooting Alex.BOTTOM LINE: That's about it, it is a kids movie, so if you're a kid, maybe you'll like it, but I suggest that you don't watch it, or at least rent it.

reviews.review_title: Just when I was beginning to have faith in my fellow man....
reviews.content: Cheesy, corny, tepid, predictable, idiotic, horrible, insipid, asinine, boring, far-fetched and stupid! Please, disregard anyone who says they liked this movie, as they're either retarded or just trying to irritate people.Home Alone 1 & 2 had a few good laughs and at the very worst were tolerable. Bumbling, clumsy burglars is one thing, but *international spies*?? Puh-leeeze! Even the dumbest 00 would simply put a bullet in the brat's head and proceed as planned("Ya guys give up, or ya thirsty for-*POW!*" heh-heh). Instead, these four idiots set themselves up for one painful and excruciating "joke" after another. Rent this and your VCR will projectile vomit pea soup.And what's this, a PARROT that says stupid things? How cute, it's not like all the other characters saying stupid things was bad enough or anything. This movie has plenty of great "gags" to it. Unfortunately, they'll all be coming from you as you're hunched over the toilet with the dry heaves from seeing this movie. It's a shame MST3K couldn't secure the rights to this cinematic lump of coal, just think of what Mike & the bots would've done to this movie!Overall rating: -4 stars (It's crap!)

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as it's made out to be
reviews.content: Yes the actors and characters from the first two films are all new , but that doesn't mean the film is automatically terrible. If you enjoyed the first two films I'm sure you will still enjoy this one.
My son and I were super confused and not even sure we had the right movie when this started. Doesn't seem worth watching. How did the franchise go from big budget to B movie? No thanks.
